page.title: 02KIPPEN PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The present church has been a place of worship since the first Sunday of May, {1827.}An earlier church once stood in the churchyard at Kippen Cross. All that remains of this is the{west gable complete with{bell-cote}and bell.An inscription on the bell dates it as being in use in{1618}in an even earlier church near{Burnton,}and later recast, enlarged and moved to its new site at the "Cross" The{architects}of the present church were members of the {Stirling family -}local landowners. It was built in the grounds of{"The Grove now the Church House by{Mr.Robert {Taylor}and{Mr.James Penny}of Stirling The building was enlarged to include the{Apse,Prayer Chapel}and{Church {House}to mark its centenary and has changed little{since.Sir D.Y.Cameron was largely responsible for this donating many furnishings.
